title: NASA Science Leadership to Hold Town Hall Meeting
summary: NASA will hold a community town hall meeting with Associate Administrator for Science Thomas H. Zurbuchen and his leadership team at 12:30 p.m. EDT Wednesday, Aug. 17.

title: No, seriously, NASA’s Space Launch System is ready to take flight
summary: The rocket may launch just two weeks from now.

title: D-Orbit cancels SPAC merger plan
summary: Space logistics company D-Orbit said Aug. 12 it has canceled plans to go public by merging with Breeze Holdings Acquisition Corp, a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC).

title: SpaceX gets $1.9 million Air Force contract for Starlink services in Europe and Africa
summary: The U.S. Air Force Special Operations Command awarded SpaceX a $1.9 million one-year contract to provide Starlink internet services in Europe and Africa starting this month.

title: Stacey Morgan recounts hitting “the wall” during her husband’s spaceflight
summary: "He isn't pale; he is gray. He doesn't look tired; he looks ancient."

title: Virgin Orbit reduces launch forecast while increasing per-launch revenue
summary: Virgin Orbit now expects to perform four launches this year, at the low end of earlier projections, but with a higher per-launch revenue.

title: Smallsat’s supply chain woes
summary: How pandemic and war dealt a double whammy to a supply chain already struggling to keep up.

title: Chinese spaceplane marks 10 days in orbit
summary: A reusable Chinese spacecraft that may resemble the U.S. Air Force’s X-37B spaceplane has logged 10 days in orbit since its Aug. 4 launch, but what it’s doing remains a mystery.

title: U.S. Army hands over satellite operations to Space Force, but keeps a foothold in space
summary: Satellite ground stations that for decades have been operated by the U.S. Army will be officially handed over to the Space Force on Aug. 15.

title: NASA, Space Force resolve SLS flight termination system issue
summary: NASA and the U.S. Space Force have resolved an issue with the flight termination system on the Space Launch System that could have cut short the vehicle’s inaugural launch campaign.
